intro: Kickxia iranica, commonly known as the Persian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to regions of Iran and Central Asia. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in mountainous areas. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation efforts.
